data.title: Eastern Michigan University Athletics
data.meta_description: EMU men's golfer Korey Mahoney was named to the PING All-Region Midwest team released by the Golf Coaches Association of America. Each of the nine PING
data.text:
YPSILANTI, Mich. – Eastern Michigan University men's golfer Korey Mahoney (East Lansing, Mich.-East Lansing) was named to the PING All-Region Midwest team released by the Golf Coaches Association of America. Each of the nine PING All-Region teams are comprised of 15 golfers and any player ranked in the top 75 nationally in either Golfstat or the Golfweek/Sagarin rankings. Members of the PING All-Region teams are eligible for PING All-America honors.

Mahoney, a two-time All-Region honoree (2005 and 2006), led the Mid-American Conference with a 72.26 per round average. The 2006 MAC Golfer of the Year wrapped up his collegiate career with a tie for 47th-place (223, +10) at the NCAA Central Regional. He finished with seven top-ten finishes and 10 top-30 finishes in 2006.

At the Wexford Intercollegiate, Feb. 27-28, Mahoney captured medalist honors with a seven-stroke victory total of 215 (70-71-74). He also fired a one-under 215 (68-73-74) at the Penn State Rutherford Intercollegiate, April 22-23, for the invitational championship. Mahoney tied for fourth at the Wolverine Intercollegiate with a six-under 207 (69-70-68) and fifth at the Hoya Invitational with a 143 (74-69). He carded a season-low 67 in the second round of the Xavier Invitational to finish ninth with a 54-hole total of 211 (70-67-74). For his career, Mahoney won four tournament titles, including two this season.

Mahoney will play the Michigan Amateur - a tournament he won before he took his first class at EMU - one more time this summer before turning professional for the Michigan Open.
